page.title: 05Hamble River again again.
page.content:
must be obtained from the Parish Council to do so. The slipways toilet facilities, water and scubbing piles are free for anyone to use, as well as the Inshore Rescue service which is based on the hard.
During the summer part of the Hamble Carnival and the annual Regatta is held on the hard. { {_THE HAMBLE-WARSASH FERRY- The history of the ferry can be traced back to the 18th century when it was one of the only means of crossing the river.Although crossings were recorded earlier on not much is known about them.The first written record of the ferry was by John Leland in an itinery of 1535-43. Then people used the ferry for trade ,and to avoid the long walk round the
